snippet: Victories for same-sex marriage in elections on Tuesday are evidence of a remarkable shift in public opinion and it is close to certain that the Supreme Court will agree to hear at least one case on the subject, with a decision expected by June.
abstract: Victories for same-sex marriage in 2012 elections in Maine, Maryland and apparently Washington State once vote counts are complete, are the first ones achieved at the ballot box rather than through courts or legislatures; results are evidence of a remarkable shift in public opinion, and are also timely data points for Supreme Court, which appears certain to hear at least one case on the subject, with a decision expected by June.
lead_paragraph: Victories for same-sex marriage in elections on Tuesday are evidence of a remarkable shift in public opinion and it is close to certain that the Supreme Court will agree to hear at least one case on the subject, with a decision expected by June.

headline.seo: Supreme Court to Begin Weighing Gay Marriage Cases
headline.main: States’ Votes for Gay Marriage Are Timely, With Justices Ready to Weigh Cases
headline.print_headline: States’ Votes for Gay Marriage Are Timely, With Justices Ready to Weigh Cases

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
